programme.title: Wolf
Vuk
programme.desc:
Wolf: Directed by Mike Nichols. With Jack Nicholson, Michelle Pfeiffer, James Spader, Kate Nelligan. Publisher Will Randall becomes a demon wolf and has to fight to keep his job." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0111742/","name":"Wolf","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjY3NTgxZGItMWU2Mi00OTQ0LTg2OGQtYWI3NzU4MTYxMTBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Publisher Will Randall becomes a demon wolf and has to fight to keep his job.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0111742/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Rammstein-2"},"dateCreated":"2000-12-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nicholson is a wolf... no surprise","reviewBody":"I like this film. It is different as a horror movie, because it really isn't a horror movie - and yet here we have a man turning into a wolf, he starts killing people at night, and we have the rabid horror music stalking our ears when the wolf is on the prowl.

I like the characters, I like the slow pace and the calm moments and I especially like Jack Nicholson when Randall's senses start to come alive. He is extremely well cast for this film, I don't think many others would actually convey the animal inside like he does. Pfieffer's character is, although formulaic, a relief among all the hard-assed men of this film. The ending is a bit silly, but nonetheless odd and intriguing.

Yep.I like this movie. It's fun to watch and it's great to see Nicholson act like the animal we all really think he is but don't dare to find out.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":54531,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Horror","Romance"],"datePublished":"1994-06-17","keywords":"werewolf,manhattan new york city,publisher,sense of smell,bradbury building","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Wolf","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1073611033","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTllM2I0ZWEtMTdlOS00ZjM5LWI2NDgtZjk2NzU5ODVlZTdiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTllM2I0ZWEtMTdlOS00ZjM5LWI2NDgtZjk2NzU5ODVlZTdiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Columbia Tristar"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000197/","name":"Jack Nicholson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000201/","name":"Michelle Pfeiffer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000652/","name":"James Spader"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001566/","name":"Mike Nichols"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0365659/","name":"Jim Harrison"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0834338/","name":"Wesley Strick"}],"duration":"PT2H5M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Secrets & Lies
Tajne i laži
programme.desc:
Secrets & Lies: Directed by Mike Leigh. With Timothy Spall, Phyllis Logan, Brenda Blethyn, Claire Rushbrook. Following the death of her adoptive parents, a successful young black optometrist establishes contact with her biological mother -- a lonely white factory worker living in poverty in East London." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0117589/","name":"Secrets & Lies","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2QzMTIxNjItNGQyNy00MjQzLWJiYTItMzIyZjdkYjYyYjRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwMzUyOTc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Following the death of her adoptive parents, a successful young black optometrist establishes contact with her biological mother -- a lonely white factory worker living in poverty in East London.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0117589/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Annyerism"},"dateCreated":"1999-10-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"A great layering of memorable characters","reviewBody":"It took a second viewing of Mike Leigh's 'Secrets and Lies' to reveal the depth of its genius. I love character-driven drama, and this film succeeds in creating indelible portraits. Even the social worker is quirky and memorable instead of just furthering the plot and being patently sympathetic.

I could write quite a lot about Blethyn's riveting performance. How drained she must have been after sustaining a character who seems always at the height of emotional pressure. Opposite her, Jean-Baptiste seemed as cool and smooth as could be. The contrasts created by these personae even extended to costume and decor.

I decided to watch this movie again because after a BBC Shakespeare binge I wanted to see everything Ron Cook has been in. And while the Stuart scene is really somewhat incongruous to the rest of the family plot, Cook's scene as the bitter, drunk 't****r' works for me perfectly. So do the scenes of photo sessions -- and it's a matter of observing this film in terms of clarity of personal vision. The occupations of photographer and optometrist seem to lend metaphors of spirituality -- for Maurice, the ability to see people as they are, and for Hortense, the ability to understand how others see the world. The wall of smoke that Cynthia and Roxanne seem to keep in front of them. The disparity between the images created for the formal portraits and the truth of the personalities in them. In a distinctly un-sappy way, Leigh has explored the old adage that "the truth will set you free."

If one reads a paragraph describing the main plot -- the adopted child seeking out her birth mother -- a very clear idea of a movie-of-the-week story comes to mind. 'Secrets and Lies' is nothing like that, and shows a mastery of vision and a cast of great talent. My roommate agreed, saying he thought this was one of the best films he's seen this decade."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":41282,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"1996-05-24","keywords":"biological mother,mother daughter relationship,birthday party,search for birth mother,family secret","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Secrets & Lies","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1220739865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzQ1ZDc5NTMtOGZhYi00NzYzLTk5NDgtODJiNmJhM2IyMzNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzQ1ZDc5NTMtOGZhYi00NzYzLTk5NDgtODJiNmJhM2IyMzNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home video trailer from October Films"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001758/","name":"Timothy Spall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000950/","name":"Brenda Blethyn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0517642/","name":"Phyllis Logan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005139/","name":"Mike Leigh"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103532/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008195/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103668/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005139/","name":"Mike Leigh"}],"duration":"PT2H16M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Underworld: Awakening
Plava laguna: Buđenje
programme.desc:
Underworld: Awakening: Directed by Måns Mårlind, Björn Stein. With Kate Beckinsale, Stephen Rea, Michael Ealy, Theo James. When human forces discover the existence of the Vampire and Lycan clans, a war to eradicate both species commences. The vampire warrior Selene leads the battle against humankind." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1496025/","name":"Underworld: Awakening","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAxMjc0ODk0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTc5NDQwNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When human forces discover the existence of the Vampire and Lycan clans, a war to eradicate both species commences. The vampire warrior Selene leads the battle against humankind.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1496025/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ocacia"},"dateCreated":"2012-01-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not bad as junk goes","reviewBody":"Lets be honest you do not go into a cinema billing "Underworld: Awakening" expecting "Silence of the Lamb" or "Elegy" this is fast food cinema. The rules of critique that might apply to Spike Lee are therefore not applicable here. So understand my rating of 7/10 is factoring in that. It is 6/10 for fast food cinema. 

The action was tight, the objectives of the film were clear. Certain "chosen one" themes i found boring and the film really must find other incentives for Werewolves to hunt vamps. There is something cool about Kate, I don't know what cuz she just looks like a normal Brit, but she is def the kick ass chick of this era. I mean would you pick her or Ms. Weaver to protect you. Well Ms. Weaver cant bounce off walls so I am sticking with Kate. 

Some parts could have been better but that is always the case. I was happy not to see certain actors but I miss that old dude, Man he was evil. I mean he was really the best. I don't know the future of the franchise and I hope it doesn't turn into the Dark Knight Cop villain relationship.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":150021,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Fantasy","Horror"],"datePublished":"2012-01-20","keywords":"vampire,selene character,woman fights a man,woman murders a man,murderess","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 3","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1011654169","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4NDE5MDUyNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzM1NzQyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4NDE5MDUyNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzM1NzQyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"When human forces discover the existence of the Vampire and Lycan clans, a war to eradicate both species commences. The vampire warrioress Selene leads the battle against humankind."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000295/","name":"Kate Beckinsale"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1013003/","name":"Michael Ealy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2086223/","name":"India Eisley"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0617523/","name":"Måns Mårlind"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0825407/","name":"Björn Stein"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010568/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005323/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0262357/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0936482/","name":"Len Wiseman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0387198/","name":"John Hlavin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0833089/","name":"J. programme.title: The Island
Sahara
programme.desc: The Island: Directed by Michael Bay. With Ewan McGregor, Scarlett Johansson, Djimon Hounsou, Sean Bean. A man living in a futuristic sterile colony begins to question his circumscribed existence when his friend is chosen to go to the Island, the last uncontaminated place on earth." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0399201/","name":"The Island","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAwNjk0NjM1ODReQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU3MDc1NjIxMzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A man living in a futuristic sterile colony begins to question his circumscribed existence when his friend is chosen to go to the Island, the last uncontaminated place on earth.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0399201/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"pekjr4"},"dateCreated":"2005-07-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"A fun ride....","reviewBody":"I liked "The Island" quite a bit due for two reasons: a depiction of the future which wasn't too "over the top", which was refreshing, coming from Bay, and that the leads were very effective at portraying their characters. McGregor, from his acting, and Johansson, from her open, fresh expression. There could have been a little more exploration of the cloning question, and I felt the action was, while visually beautiful, mundane. The score was outstanding, the theme beautifully matching the opening to the film. Pity there wasn't more of it. Sean Bean, to those used to his villainous work in "Patriot Games", and "Goldeneye", was a little weak, but due to writing, not his thespian skills. And what's a Micheal Bay or Cohen Brothers movie without Steve Buscemi? His character was relatively weak, with no real motivation behind his actions in the film. Djimon Hounsou has a pretty good part. Nice to see him carry a substantial role. One good reason to see the film: great visuals, good looking people with consistent positive ideals. Pretty to watch.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":307439,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2005-08-24","keywords":"year 2019,island,clone,same actor playing two characters simultaneously on screen,cityscape","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Island","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2968781081","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmIwYzA2ZmMtZjFmNS00ZjdkLTk1MDAtNjM5Yjg0ZDQ2Y2QxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmIwYzA2ZmMtZjFmNS00ZjdkLTk1MDAtNjM5Yjg0ZDQ2Y2QxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Dreamworks"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0424060/","name":"Scarlett Johansson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000191/","name":"Ewan McGregor"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005023/","name":"Djimon Hounsou"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000881/","name":"Michael Bay"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1047021/","name":"Caspian Tredwell-Owen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0476064/","name":"Alex Kurtzman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0649460/","name":"Roberto Orci"}],"duration":"PT2H16M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: My Best Friend's Girl
Djevojka mog prijatelja
programme.desc:
My Best Friend's Girl: Directed by Howard Deutch. With Dane Cook, Kate Hudson, Alec Baldwin, Jason Biggs. Tank faces the ultimate test of friendship when his best friend hires him to take his ex-girlfriend out on a lousy date in order to make her realize how great her former boyfriend is." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1046163/","name":"My Best Friend's Girl","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg4MDg5NjE3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzc4ODQ3MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Tank faces the ultimate test of friendship when his best friend hires him to take his ex-girlfriend out on a lousy date in order to make her realize how great her former boyfriend is.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1046163/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jacob-noergaard"},"dateCreated":"2008-11-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Be no means a classic, but...","reviewBody":"I'm not particularly into Dane Cook. Got nothing against him, either.

Sure, the movie is somewhat clichéd and brings nothing new to the table, but while it might not be an instant classic, it does include some rather hilarious scenes.

My favourite scene must be the scene in "Cheesus Crust". Call me low-level, but that was funny as hell. I laughed like I hadn't laughed in ages. It was great.

Perhaps one of the factors that made me like the movie is the fact, that I can be somewhat of an asshole myself. Yeah, I recognized some of the actions from myself. Not that I'm proud of it.

Yes, many of the jokes aren't gonna make you burst out laughing and the whole romantic scheme is kinda yawn-inspiring, but it kept me entertained and my mug glued to the screen. And that's why I gave it a solid 7.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":43565,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2008-09-19","keywords":"thong panties,female rear nudity,breasts,scantily clad female,stupid victim","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"My Best Friend's Girl: Theatrical Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi803733785","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk2MTM4MzM3OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjgyOTgyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk2MTM4MzM3OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjgyOTgyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the theatrical trailer for My Best Friend's Girl, directed by Howard Deutch."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005028/","name":"Kate Hudson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0176981/","name":"Dane Cook"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004755/","name":"Jason Biggs"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0222043/","name":"Howard Deutch"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0173285/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0192833/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0163783/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2588827/","name":"Jordan Cahan"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: I Know What You Did Last Summer
Znam što si radila prošlog ljeta
programme.desc:
I Know What You Did Last Summer: Directed by Jim Gillespie. With Jennifer Love Hewitt, Sarah Michelle Gellar, Ryan Phillippe, Freddie Prinze Jr.. Four young friends bound by a tragic accident are reunited when they find themselves being stalked by a hook-wielding maniac in their small seaside town." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119345/","name":"I Know What You Did Last Summer","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDI4ODJlNGUtNjFiMy00ODgzLWIzYjgtMzgyZTljZDQ2NGZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four young friends bound by a tragic accident are reunited when they find themselves being stalked by a hook-wielding maniac in their small seaside town.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119345/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Xophianic"},"dateCreated":"2000-02-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Watch SCREAM instead","reviewBody":"I saw SCREAM and SCREAM 2 before I saw I KNOW WHAT YOU DID LAST SUMMER. I think that I KNOW WHAT YOU DID LAST SUMMER is a rip-off of SCREAM, but a rip-off that can be enjoyed. Plots are similar, but not identical. It also has the similar pretty-teenager-being-stabbed-to-death feel to it.

On graduation night, four friends Julie James (Jennifer Love Hewitt), Helen Shivers (Sarah Michelle Gellar), Barry Cox (Ryan Phillippe) and Ray Bronson (Freddie Prinze Jr.) go joyriding while drunk and accidentally run over and supposedly kill somebody in the street. While dumping the body in a bay, the body attacks Barry, then falls into the water. The four assume that he is dead, but the next summer they get notes saying "I know what you did last summer". The next thing you know, friends of the four are being murdered left and right and these four become the killer's next targets.

The plot is fair, but not especially interesting. I found the SCREAM plot to be much better. The acting and character development in SCREAM are better too. Jennifer Love Hewitt and Sarah Michelle Gellar both do excellent jobs. Freddie Prinze Jr. is the worst actor I've ever seen in my life, and Ryan Phillippe does a fair job. Ann Heche is very good in the part that she has.

The characters, aside from Hewitt, Gellar and Heche, are very thin and rather boring. The killer himself is pretty interesting and fairly cool. The ending of this movie bites. It's maybe worth a rent, but if you want to see a movie of this style I'd recommend URBAN LEGENDS or SCREAM.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":138305,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"1997-10-17","keywords":"stupid victim,taking a shower,teen slasher,teenage girl,slasher killer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"I Know What You Did Last Summer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi663666457","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwMDBiYmQtZDJkNC00NjQxLTlkZWEtMzMyN2RkOTBkY2YxXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwMDBiYmQtZDJkNC00NjQxLTlkZWEtMzMyN2RkOTBkY2YxXkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001349/","name":"Jennifer Love Hewitt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001264/","name":"Sarah Michelle Gellar"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000162/","name":"Anne Heche"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0318947/","name":"Jim Gillespie"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033437/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011134/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0147895/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0242028/","name":"Lois Duncan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0932078/","name":"Kevin Williamson"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Driven
Braven
programme.desc: Driven: Directed by Nick Hamm. With Jason Sudeikis, Lee Pace, Judy Greer, Isabel Arraiza. Intense thriller where politics, big business and narcotics collide." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5592796/","name":"Driven","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDFlMzM5YjctZjRlMC00MzAzLWFjODctN2MzMWE3MDBlOGNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzQwMTY2Nzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Intense thriller where politics, big business and narcotics collide.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5592796/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"corvette-45921"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Why the Sudeikis hate","reviewBody":"I'm usually the first to jump on SNL cast members making movies because they drag half of the cast with them, then you get the long skit version effect - but this is not that movie. Sudeikis is great as the annoying weirdo and has good chemistry with all the players around him. programme.title: Ubijanje Eve
programme.desc: Eve je operativka sigurnosne službe. Veoma je pametna, dosadan joj je kancelarijski posao, i ne ispunjava njena maštanja o tome da postane špijun. Villanelle je otmjena, voli luksuz, koji joj pruža... Eve je operativka sigurnosne službe. Veoma je pametna, dosadan joj je kancelarijski posao, i ne ispunjava njena maštanja o tome da postane špijun. Villanelle je otmjena, voli luksuz, koji joj pruža njen muž, ali je i talentirana ubica... Ove dvije izrazito inteligentne žene, podjednako opsjednute jedna drugom, direktno se sukobljavaju u epskoj igri mačke i miša.

programme.title: The Art of War
Sam protiv svih
programme.desc:
The Art of War: Directed by Christian Duguay. With Wesley Snipes, Anne Archer, Maury Chaykin, Marie Matiko. UN's secretary general uses covert operations to help diplomacy along. Shaw's called back 6 months after one such operation. He witnesses the murder of Chinese UN ambassador at UN, NYC, chases the assassin and ends up a suspect." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0160009/","name":"The Art of War","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzAyMjE2MDI3M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNTIwMzg2._V1_.jpg","description":"UN's secretary general uses covert operations to help diplomacy along. Shaw's called back 6 months after one such operation. He witnesses the murder of Chinese UN ambassador at UN, NYC, chases the assassin and ends up a suspect.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0160009/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"michaelsibley416"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"great film","reviewBody":"Wesley Snipes is back better than ever in "The Art Of War," a movie that is so good it deserves to be among the top ten of the summer.

There are many reasons why I enjoyed "The Art Of War." The first reason was the supporting cast. When I first saw Donald Sutherland in this movie, I knew it would be a thing of beauty. He brought great credibility as he made a good movie, that much better. Anne Archer is one actress you can always count on to give a good performance. 

"The Art Of War" turned out to be a montage of "The Fugitive" series and "Enemy Of The State." While this is the only negative thing about this film, it didn't deter me from enjoying it to my heart's content.

There are many other things about "The Art Of War" such as the high-tech wizadry and action-filled sequences that were very enjoyable. However, the best thing about this film was the storyline. "The Art Of War" had beautiful twists toward the end of the film. In addition, there are scenes in this movie that are so good they must be seen to believe they are that good."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":29456,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Crime"],"datePublished":"2000-08-25","keywords":"hero murders a woman,nude wears eyeglasses,fbi federal bureau of investigation,motor vehicle,car","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Art of War","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1820918041","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2VhZjllMDUtODkzYi00NTc0LTg0YTctMTFjNTljY2ZiYWVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2VhZjllMDUtODkzYi00NTc0LTg0YTctMTFjNTljY2ZiYWVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000648/","name":"Wesley Snipes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000271/","name":"Anne Archer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001999/","name":"Maury Chaykin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240995/","name":"Christian Duguay"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043393/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0078451/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0063511/","name":"Wayne Beach"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0058164/","name":"Simon Barry"}],"duration":"PT1H57M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Branded
Branded
programme.desc:
Branded: Directed by Jamie Bradshaw, Aleksandr Dulerayn. With Ed Stoppard, Leelee Sobieski, Jeffrey Tambor, Max von Sydow. In future Moscow, where corporate brands have created a disillusioned population, one man's effort to unlock the truth behind the conspiracy will lead to an epic battle with hidden forces that control the world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1368440/","name":"Branded","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk1NjI3NzQ5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjMyNjM5Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In future Moscow, where corporate brands have created a disillusioned population, one man's effort to unlock the truth behind the conspiracy will lead to an epic battle with hidden forces that control the world.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1368440/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jmbwithcats"},"dateCreated":"2012-10-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"A little dose of reality","reviewBody":"This is a great little movie that has a very relevant message about what we put in and on our bodies. Hopefully it will make people more aware, but honestly I doubt the ignorant masses will watch this movie. 

Judging from the low ratings on IMDb, I can officially call the movie "BRANDED" highly underrated, and a must see film for anyone who wants even a glimpse of responsibility for what we put in and on our bodies that leads to so much disease, war and suffering.

A unique perspective, full of detail, a hero's journey to find substance in a world gone mad.

Great imagery, dystopian atmosphere and what the world is like that most walk through simply unaware, and not wanting to care.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9022,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2012-09-07","keywords":"advertising agency,fast food,hamburger,hallucination,constellation","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1015653657","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM0NDMxMTMyN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjQwMzYxOA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM0NDMxMTMyN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjQwMzYxOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Set in a dystopian future where corporate brands have created a disillusioned population, one man's effort to unlock the truth behind the conspiracy will lead to an epic battle with hidden forces that control the world."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0832380/","name":"Ed Stoppard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005447/","name":"Leelee Sobieski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001787/","name":"Jeffrey Tambor"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1972793/","name":"Jamie Bradshaw"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1856884/","name":"Aleksandr Dulerayn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0244075/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0487217/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1972793/","name":"Jamie Bradshaw"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1856884/","name":"Aleksandr Dulerayn"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Sydney White
Super luzeri
programme.desc:
Sydney White: Directed by Joe Nussbaum. With Amanda Bynes, Sara Paxton, Matt Long, Jack Carpenter. A modern retelling of Snow White set against students in their freshman year of college in the greek system." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0815244/","name":"Sydney White","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk3ODc3ODAxN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzcwMDU1MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A modern retelling of Snow White set against students in their freshman year of college in the greek system.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0815244/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mollymormonbrat"},"dateCreated":"2007-09-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not the most original, but sweet, harmless and entertaining!","reviewBody":"Maybe I just haven't seen a good "teen girl" movie in so long. In fact, I don't remember the last time I went and saw a "teen girl" movie. Maybe if there were more out there was fun as this, I would. Basically, I had boring, rainy Saturday and a little sister. The trip to the theatre wound up with the two us laughing our heads off and all the appropriate "aww" moments.

The premise is a modern-day Snow White on a college campus. A little contrived, but hey, it apparently worked. Sydney is your average tomboy who is under all sorts of pressure to pledge herself to her dead mother's old sorority. Well, the sorority girls are no longer what they used to be, and the pampered princesses throw Sydney out into the rain. She winds up taking refuge at the Vortex, a student housing building where lives the guy she dumped for a sorority mission and his six bizarre roommates.

Honestly, I didn't think it would work. But it did, and besides the cuteness there is a little more moral meat as Sydney and her new friends lead a student body revolution. Yeah, it's cheesy and we've seen the revenge-of-the-nerds theme many a time before, but it's so goodhearted and fun that I couldn't help but love it, stereotypes, predictability, and all.

All the characters seemed very much into their roles. I wouldn't say I'm an Amanda Bynes fan, but she failed to annoy me this time around! It was a great blend of an old story with modern college life with clever, roll-your-eyes references to the original Disney animated film. It might bother some people, but as a Snow White fan I thought they were cute. 

It's definitely a girl movie, I'll give you that, so if you can't put up with the silliness and the cheesiness, you will not enjoy it. But if you're a girl looking for a cute movie with a lot of harmless fun, this will hit the spot. This is one I will definitely buy on DVD and watch when I need something light and fun.

Not the most artistic of film making and not a whole lot of focus on in-depth characters and originality, but as a former teenage girl, I will happily give this adorable little film 7/10 for sheer sweetness, a good heart, and a passion for doing the right thing. Sometimes we just need that girly spunk.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":47414,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2008-04-16","keywords":"college,sorority,college girl,female protagonist,sorority house","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sydney White","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3752919321","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2MzQ0NTI1OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTA1NjYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2MzQ0NTI1OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTA1NjYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Sydney White - Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004789/","name":"Amanda Bynes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668139/","name":"Sara Paxton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1668265/","name":"Matt Long"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0638271/","name":"Joe Nussbaum"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0201512/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0097249/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1548657/","name":"Chad Gomez Creasey"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0815244, Title: Sydney White, --- Description: Sydney White: Directed by Joe Nussbaum. With Amanda Bynes, Sara Paxton, Matt Long, Jack Carpenter. A modern retelling of Snow White set against students in their freshman year of college in the greek system." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0815244/","name":"Sydney White","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk3ODc3ODAxN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzcwMDU1MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A modern retelling of Snow White set against students in their freshman year of college in the greek system.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0815244/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"mollymormonbrat","dateCreated":"2007-09-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not the most original, but sweet, harmless and entertaining!","reviewBody":"Maybe I just haven't seen a good "teen girl" movie in so long. In fact, I don't remember the last time I went and saw a "teen girl" movie. Maybe if there were more out there was fun as this, I would. Basically, I had boring, rainy Saturday and a little sister. The trip to the theatre wound up with the two us laughing our heads off and all the appropriate "aww" moments.

The premise is a modern-day Snow White on a college campus. A little contrived, but hey, it apparently worked. Sydney is your average tomboy who is under all sorts of pressure to pledge herself to her dead mother's old sorority. Well, the sorority girls are no longer what they used to be, and the pampered princesses throw Sydney out into the rain. She winds up taking refuge at the Vortex, a student housing building where lives the guy she dumped for a sorority mission and his six bizarre roommates.

Honestly, I didn't think it would work. But it did, and besides the cuteness there is a little more moral meat as Sydney and her new friends lead a student body revolution. Yeah, it's cheesy and we've seen the revenge-of-the-nerds theme many a time before, but it's so goodhearted and fun that I couldn't help but love it, stereotypes, predictability, and all.

All the characters seemed very much into their roles. I wouldn't say I'm an Amanda Bynes fan, but she failed to annoy me this time around! It was a great blend of an old story with modern college life with clever, roll-your-eyes references to the original Disney animated film. It might bother some people, but as a Snow White fan I thought they were cute. 

It's definitely a girl movie, I'll give you that, so if you can't put up with the silliness and the cheesiness, you will not enjoy it. But if you're a girl looking for a cute movie with a lot of harmless fun, this will hit the spot. This is one I will definitely buy on DVD and watch when I need something light and fun.

Not the most artistic of film making and not a whole lot of focus on in-depth characters and originality, but as a former teenage girl, I will happily give this adorable little film 7/10 for sheer sweetness, a good heart, and a passion for doing the right thing. Sometimes we just need that girly spunk.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":47414,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2008-04-16","keywords":"college,sorority,college girl,female protagonist,sorority house","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sydney White","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3752919321","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2MzQ0NTI1OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTA1NjYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2MzQ0NTI1OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTA1NjYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Sydney White - Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004789/","name":"Amanda Bynes","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668139/","name":"Sara Paxton","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1668265/","name":"Matt Long"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0638271/","name":"Joe Nussbaum"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0201512/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0097249/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1548657/","name":"Chad Gomez Creasey"],"duration":"PT1H48M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: A Different Loyalty
Druga odanost
programme.desc:
A Different Loyalty: Directed by Marek Kanievska. With Sharon Stone, Rupert Everett, Julian Wadham, Michael Cochrane. British war reporter Leo and American journalist Sally meet on assignment in Beirut. When Leo disappears, Sally begins to uncover his secret life, which leads her behind the Iron Curtain and into the clutches of the KGB. In HD." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0326828/","name":"A Different Loyalty","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjg1OTVhMzItZjAzYi00Y2E1LTlhNTMtMTU3OTNkNDAwZjk2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"British war reporter Leo and American journalist Sally meet on assignment in Beirut. When Leo disappears, Sally begins to uncover his secret life, which leads her behind the Iron Curtain and into the clutches of the KGB. In HD.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0326828/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kostu-san"},"dateCreated":"2004-08-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Avoid..","reviewBody":"Watching this movie was a very disappointing experience. The premise was good (like with most movies out there), but the execution was just atrocious, and the story was unrealistic at best. For example, the movie shows us that a westerner was allowed to go in and out of Soviet Union, as well as go though streets of Moscow without any surveillance in the midst of cold war!!

Moreover, the actors seemed like they were made out of wood in terms of expressiveness. The story was painfully slow and was heading nowhere, really: nothing changed nor happened though the entire movie...

Funny how our protagonists had a view at the Basilica of Christ the Saviour in early 70s (Destroyed in early 20th century, restored in late 90s by the mayor of Moscow)... This and many other anachronisms give out the fact that the production team didn't even research the subject of their work before filming...

2/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1444,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Romance","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2004-10-14","keywords":"flashback,spy,father son relationship,treason,englishman abroad","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"A Different Loyalty","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2075394329","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzEwNWUzYWUtNDhjOC00MTAwLThkOTYtMDZlOGNhMWQxZGE1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzEwNWUzYWUtNDhjOC00MTAwLThkOTYtMDZlOGNhMWQxZGE1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Artisan"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000232/","name":"Sharon Stone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000391/","name":"Rupert Everett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0905554/","name":"Julian Wadham"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0437709/","name":"Marek Kanievska"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0060306/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0126277/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0104832/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0682063/","name":"Jim Piddock"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The English Patient
Engleski pacijent
programme.desc: The English Patient: Directed by Anthony Minghella. With Ralph Fiennes, Juliette Binoche, Willem Dafoe, Kristin Scott Thomas. At the close of World War II, a young nurse tends to a badly-burned plane crash victim. His past is shown in flashbacks, revealing an involvement in a fateful love affair." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0116209/","name":"The English Patient","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTkxZTdkNTQtM2QwOS00NzRlLWEyMGItYTcxOTE4NTgyNGVhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"At the close of World War II, a young nurse tends to a badly-burned plane crash victim. His past is shown in flashbacks, revealing an involvement in a fateful love affair.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0116209/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"littlemartinarocena"},"dateCreated":"2009-05-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Anthony Minghella's Heart and Mind","reviewBody":"It is a strangely powerful and moving experience to see "The English Patient" again after Anthony Minghella's death. Most of his body of work is dedicated to one shattering point. The endless moral struggle of those who, consciously, walk a very thin line. In "The Talented Mr Ripley" Minghella moves away from Patricia Highsmith's amoral Tom Ripley to give the murderer a conscience. In "Breaking And Entering" Minghella gives Jude Law's character the need to confess and the rewards are chillingly moving. Here, in "The English Patient", the characters in love are never too far away from their corroding feeling of guilt. Ralph Finnes and Kristin Scott Thomas are extraordinary. They strip their characters from every pretense in a compelling complicity with us, the audience. Juliette Binoche is, quite simply, spectacular and her scenes with the wonderful Naveen Andrews are filled with a "Minghellian" sensual innocence. Anthony Minghella gave us films that were,one way or another, that elusive mix of art and commerce. He was true to himself but thought about his audience. He knew how to push our buttons without betraying his own. There is something clear, honest and startling about Minghella's opus. I miss him already but I'm grateful for the reflection of his soul he left behind.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":184174,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Romance","War"],"datePublished":"1996-12-06","keywords":"patient,nurse,flashback,english,church","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The English Patient","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi561882649","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjU5YjA1MGMtOTJlZi00MzQzLTgxYWQtZGNlNjI0NzgyZmY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjU5YjA1MGMtOTJlZi00MzQzLTgxYWQtZGNlNjI0NzgyZmY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for The English Patient"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000146/","name":"Ralph Fiennes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000300/","name":"Juliette Binoche"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000353/","name":"Willem Dafoe"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005237/","name":"Anthony Minghella"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0034657/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0648546/","name":"Michael Ondaatje"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005237/","name":"Anthony Minghella"}],"duration":"PT2H42M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: L'heure d'été
Ljetni sati
programme.desc:
L'heure d'été: Directed by Olivier Assayas. With Juliette Binoche, Charles Berling, Jérémie Renier, Edith Scob. Two brothers and a sister witness the disappearance of their childhood memories when they must relinquish the family belongings to ensure their deceased mother's succession." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0836700/","name":"L'heure d'été","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUxNjU0Njc0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjcyNDY1Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two brothers and a sister witness the disappearance of their childhood memories when they must relinquish the family belongings to ensure their deceased mother's succession.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0836700/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mehmet_kurtkaya"},"dateCreated":"2009-05-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Generations told through the eyes of objects!","reviewBody":"Up until now, you may have seen films that are told through the eyes of a specific character, a child or even a dog. However this film achieves the impossible, it tells the story of generations through the eyes of the objects! The film opens with a large family gathering in a gorgeous old house located in French countryside. The house lies in the middle of a large garden and hosts beautiful antique furniture the owner, mother of three middle aged children, inherited from her uncle. A year later, she dies and the children have to decide about the fate of the house and the furniture.

Anyone who has lost a parent or an elder family member possibly has gone through these difficulties depicted so naturally in the film. However, the movie goes beyond the initial thoughts and feelings. Delicate questions asked by this movie are multifaceted and explore the effects of capitalist globalization on generations.

Those objects have memories in them. When they are left to a museum, they seemingly belong to the society as whole but to no one at the same time.

The elder brother, professor of economy, who lives in France wants to preserve the house, he wants to stick to his roots, to family memories but his brother and sister want to follow their careers in China and US. Yes, by doing so they live in the moment and yes, they are not confined to France and yes, the whole world is theirs but they are also left with nothing. Like objects displayed in the museum.

And this duality lives on until the ironic ending, which can be interpreted as optimistic or pessimistic by viewers even tough pessimistic tone is definitely more prevalent.

Beautiful acting by Binoche, Charles Berling, Edith Scob and wonderful directing and writing by Assayas. IMDb data; ttnr: 0836700, Title: L'heure d'été, --- Description: L'heure d'été: Directed by Olivier Assayas. With Juliette Binoche, Charles Berling, Jérémie Renier, Edith Scob. Two brothers and a sister witness the disappearance of their childhood memories when they must relinquish the family belongings to ensure their deceased mother's succession." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0836700/","name":"L'heure d'été","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUxNjU0Njc0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjcyNDY1Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two brothers and a sister witness the disappearance of their childhood memories when they must relinquish the family belongings to ensure their deceased mother's succession.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0836700/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"mehmet_kurtkaya","dateCreated":"2009-05-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Generations told through the eyes of objects!","reviewBody":"Up until now, you may have seen films that are told through the eyes of a specific character, a child or even a dog. However this film achieves the impossible, it tells the story of generations through the eyes of the objects! The film opens with a large family gathering in a gorgeous old house located in French countryside. The house lies in the middle of a large garden and hosts beautiful antique furniture the owner, mother of three middle aged children, inherited from her uncle. A year later, she dies and the children have to decide about the fate of the house and the furniture.

Anyone who has lost a parent or an elder family member possibly has gone through these difficulties depicted so naturally in the film. However, the movie goes beyond the initial thoughts and feelings. Delicate questions asked by this movie are multifaceted and explore the effects of capitalist globalization on generations.

Those objects have memories in them. When they are left to a museum, they seemingly belong to the society as whole but to no one at the same time.

The elder brother, professor of economy, who lives in France wants to preserve the house, he wants to stick to his roots, to family memories but his brother and sister want to follow their careers in China and US. Yes, by doing so they live in the moment and yes, they are not confined to France and yes, the whole world is theirs but they are also left with nothing. Like objects displayed in the museum.

And this duality lives on until the ironic ending, which can be interpreted as optimistic or pessimistic by viewers even tough pessimistic tone is definitely more prevalent.

Beautiful acting by Binoche, Charles Berling, Edith Scob and wonderful directing and writing by Assayas. This movie is just lifelike, simple but complex!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7490,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Family"],"datePublished":"2008-03-05","keywords":"family relationships,child,cigar smoking,climbing up a wall,memory","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Summer Hours","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi509412121","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIwNDMzMjQ3MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzU4OTY0Mg@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIwNDMzMjQ3MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzU4OTY0Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two brothers and a sister witness the disappearance of their childhood memories when they must relinquish the family belongings to ensure their deceased mother's succession. ","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000300/","name":"Juliette Binoche","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0075650/","name":"Charles Berling","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0753737/","name":"Jérémie Renier"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000801/","name":"Olivier Assayas"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022545/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044140/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000801/","name":"Olivier Assayas"],"duration":"PT1H43M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Final Countdown
Konačno odbrojavanje
programme.desc:
The Final Countdown: Directed by Don Taylor. With Kirk Douglas, Martin Sheen, Katharine Ross, James Farentino. A modern aircraft carrier is thrown back in time to 1941 near Hawaii, just hours before the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0080736/","name":"The Final Countdown","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGU5Y2UzZjMtY2M0ZC00YzE4LWJmYjYtNWNiMTlhNDEzMmViXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjY3MjUzNDk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A modern aircraft carrier is thrown back in time to 1941 near Hawaii, just hours before the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0080736/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lawprof"},"dateCreated":"2004-04-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"When the Propmaster is the Chief of Naval Operations","reviewBody":"Making a military movie without official cooperation can be difficult. If the story doesn't require major air or naval assets, a script disapproved of by the top brass can be convincingly brought to the screen. Two examples - both true stories that the Pentagon didn't want to support - are "Men of Honor" reflecting the epidemic racism of the not-that-long-ago Navy and "Sgt. Bilko," a film portraying what some noncoms do to earn extra income (trust me, it's a true story: a real Sgt. Bilko worked (officially but not actually) for me when I was an Army officer.

But when you need lots of planes and ships, you gotta have official help. And few movies have gotten more assistance than the producer, director and cast of "The Final Countdown," now available on DVD,a sci-fi recruiting spectacular that features - on loan at taxpayer expense - the huge carrier U.S.S. Nimitz complete with crew. Now that's cooperation!

Kirk Douglas skippers the supercarrier which is on Pacific Fleet maneuvers. On board as some sort of efficiency consultant is a young Martin Sheen, not yet ready for the West Wing. A mysterious and never explained weather phenomenon grips the mighty floating air base and to the unfolding amazement of captain, officers and crew dawns the realization that the Nimitz in sailing not that far from Pearl Harbor on 6 December 1941.

Meanwhile a U.S. senator, played by one of Hollywood's deservedly decorated war heroes, Charles Durning, is enjoying his yacht, also near Pearl, while dictating to his lovely secretary, Katharine Ross. A brace of Japanese Zeroes sink the yacht, killing two passengers which then prompts the carrier C.O. to order trailing F-14 Tomcats to "splash" the "enemy." Durning and Ross are rescued. Without a word, this talented actor's face does a comical double-take when introduced to the ship's executive officer who just happens to be black (in 1941 a black navy man could only serve as a steward in the officers mess. That was it. Period.)

The dilemma facing Douglas, of course, is a classic time-travel conundrum. To interfere with the course of history (the carrier's air wing can make instant teriyaki of the six Japanese carriers) or to let events take their known and disastrous course.

A chaste incipient romance between the nearly drowned damsel and the carrier's Commander Air Group competes with the white knuckle decision-making struggle of the C.O.

So much for the plot. What is on offer here is a demonstration of every aircraft type, fixed-wing and rotary, deployed on the vessel as well as demonstrations of shipboard activities ranging from retrieving a damaged jet to going to General Quarters to...you name it. The technical advisers knew they had a film crew pliant to every suggestion. The result is a genuinely exciting show- a great warship going through its paces. And, unlike "Tora Tora Tora" it doesn't appear that any genuine sailors were harmed in the making of the movie.

There's one big problem. A science fiction story is usually utterly improbable, indeed impossible, but its internal logic is vital: it must be consistent. Spielberg understands that very well. Watch the first couple of minutes when Sheen is greeted by his employer's lackey and the last minutes when he debarks from the Nimitz. Something is very, very off-kilter. Could the CEO of a great military-industrial conglomerate have used top secret technology to send the carrier back to 1941 for...

So what. This is a beautifully filmed adventure story, not a great film. The cast probably relished taking over the carrier for a while and the real captain, never shown, surely wished that the Navy hadn't banned hard spirits from our ships in World War I. But all emerge unscathed in a genuinely entertaining romp through time.

8/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":22736,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"1980-08-01","keywords":"time travel into the past,aircraft carrier,time travel,tragedy,japanese abroad","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2724838937","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdkZWMxYmUtMmJkZS00ZTY0LWI2YzAtZDk0ZTQ0YmYzZTBmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdkZWMxYmUtMmJkZS00ZTY0LWI2YzAtZDk0ZTQ0YmYzZTBmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000018/","name":"Kirk Douglas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000640/","name":"Martin Sheen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001684/","name":"Katharine Ross"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0852279/","name":"Don Taylor"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0068126/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0729297/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073529/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0403065/","name":"Thomas Hunter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0694268/","name":"Peter Powell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0024388/","name":"David Ambrose"}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Are We There Yet
Jesmo li stigli?
programme.desc: Are We There Yet?: Directed by Brian Levant. With Ice Cube, Nia Long, Aleisha Allen, Philip Bolden. To impress a foxy divorcee, ladies' man Nick offers to take her kids on an extended road trip, unaware of the torture he's in for." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0368578/","name":"Are We There Yet?","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWYwZGI3MTgtMTNiZS00ZWYyLThmYjAtMjkwZTU4M2IxNjI5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"To impress a foxy divorcee, ladies' man Nick offers to take her kids on an extended road trip, unaware of the torture he's in for.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0368578/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"srmtn1"},"dateCreated":"2005-08-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Real laughs from clean comedy and a cute story line","reviewBody":"What is up with the low ratings? This movie had us laughing all the way through it! Clean, somewhat predictable but in a fresh way. These kids did great in the movie; we enjoyed it a lot! Could easily lend itself to a sequel and another "road trip" kind of scenario. I see it as engaging and charming as "Home Alone" was so many years ago. I did think the mother's reaction at the end was a little extreme and that could have gone differently, but I didn't expect an Oscar-winning storyline with this fun, punchy, movie. I guess if there had been more swearing, sex, and violence it would have caught on better; seems to be where our culture likes to go these days. I say kudos to the writers and actors...you done good with this one and guess what...we're going to watch it again today!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":30922,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2005-05-25","keywords":"braces,new year,children,highway travel,road movie","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Are We There Yet?","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1991704857","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjNmMWQ4YTMtNjQ2Zi00YmRkLWE4MmYtZjlhMzc5MTRkNGRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjNmMWQ4YTMtNjQ2Zi00YmRkLWE4MmYtZjlhMzc5MTRkNGRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001084/","name":"Ice Cube"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000505/","name":"Nia Long"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0020248/","name":"Aleisha Allen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0505152/","name":"Brian Levant"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003580/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044714/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1027958/","name":"Steven Gary Banks"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1257282/","name":"Claudia Grazioso"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0826425/","name":"J. I did think the mother's reaction at the end was a little extreme and that could have gone differently, but I didn't expect an Oscar-winning storyline with this fun, punchy, movie. I guess if there had been more swearing, sex, and violence it would have caught on better; seems to be where our culture likes to go these days. I say kudos to the writers and actors...you done good with this one and guess what...we're going to watch it again today!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":30922,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.7,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2005-05-25","keywords":"braces,new year,children,highway travel,road movie","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Are We There Yet?","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1991704857","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjNmMWQ4YTMtNjQ2Zi00YmRkLWE4MmYtZjlhMzc5MTRkNGRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjNmMWQ4YTMtNjQ2Zi00YmRkLWE4MmYtZjlhMzc5MTRkNGRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001084/","name":"Ice Cube","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000505/","name":"Nia Long","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0020248/","name":"Aleisha Allen"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0505152/","name":"Brian Levant"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003580/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044714/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1027958/","name":"Steven Gary Banks","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1257282/","name":"Claudia Grazioso","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0826425/","name":"J. programme.title: Ace Ventura: Pet Detective
Ace Ventura: Šašavi detektiv
programme.desc:
Ace Ventura: Pet Detective: Directed by Tom Shadyac. With Jim Carrey, Courteney Cox, Sean Young, Tone Loc. A goofy detective specializing in animals goes in search of the missing mascot of the Miami Dolphins." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0109040/","name":"Ace Ventura: Pet Detective","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmVhNmFmOGYtZjgwNi00ZGQ0LThiMmQtOGZjMDUzNzJhMGIzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A goofy detective specializing in animals goes in search of the missing mascot of the Miami Dolphins.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0109040/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Anonymous_Maxine"},"dateCreated":"2001-07-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Sure, this is cheeseball comedy, but Jim Carrey makes it memorable.","reviewBody":"Ace Ventura is the kind of comedy that stems directly from a TV show, and in this case, that show was probably In Living Color, where Carrey got most of his publicity before he became famous as a movie actor. A quick look through Carrey's filmography will prove that Ace Ventura is the film that really acted as a springboard for his career. He had a few small roles in films previous to Ace Ventura, the largest of which was probably his role as one of the aliens in the awful film Earth Girls Are Easy, but after Ace Ventura, his career skyrocketed. The Mask (hey, he's still new, give the guy a break), Dumb & Dumber, a sequel to Ace Ventura, Liar Liar, The Cable Guy (oops), The Truman Show (ah, better), Man On The Moon, Me, Myself & Irene, The Grinch, and there's no end in sight.

Sure, Ace Ventura does not compare to half of these movies, and is clearly more on the side of the bone-headed comedy that he was doing on In Living Color, but his talent is unmistakable. I first saw this movie when I was in high school, and I remember that I would ditch school and go to the theater to see it and I would laugh hysterically until my sides hurt every time I saw it. There's something about seeing a slob at a tremendously rich party who just doesn't care about the etiquette of the rich people. Did anyone not laugh when he was `testing' the food at Ron Kamp's I'm-the-richest-man-in-the-universe party and stuck his tongue out at that poor guy next to him? That whole scene at that party is classic!

And, of course, it only gets better with Ace's dealings with Lois Einhorn. The whole crying game idea may have gone a little too far, but it was always amusing. Jim Carrey saves Ace Ventura from sinking to the totally brainless level of more recent crapfests as the Scary Movies, and even makes this into one of the better comedies of 1994. This is not the type of movie that is likely to win any awards, but you will remember the hilarious dialogue and Jim Carrey's immediately recognizable rubber-faced antics in this film that served as a spring board to his career, which later brought us many more excellent movies. Way to go, Jim.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":286784,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"1994-02-04","keywords":"stupidity,nudity,detective,owner dog relationship,master dog relationship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3562847001","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzAyMGUyOGMtNThjNC00ODM0LWI0M2ItNmI1NGExMmMyN2U0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzAyMGUyOGMtNThjNC00ODM0LWI0M2ItNmI1NGExMmMyN2U0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A goofy detective specializing in animals goes in search of the missing mascot of the Miami Dolphins. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000120/","name":"Jim Carrey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001073/","name":"Courteney Cox"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000707/","name":"Sean Young"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001723/","name":"Tom Shadyac"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0077062/","name":"Jack Bernstein"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001723/","name":"Tom Shadyac"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000120/","name":"Jim Carrey"}],"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Basic Instinct 2
Niske strasti 2
programme.desc:
Basic Instinct 2: Directed by Michael Caton-Jones. With Stan Collymore, Sharon Stone, Neil Maskell, David Thewlis. Novelist Catherine Tramell is once again in trouble with the law, and Scotland Yard appoints psychiatrist Dr. Michael Glass to evaluate her. Though, like Detective Nick Curran before him, Glass is entranced by Tramell and lured into a seductive game." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0430912/","name":"Basic Instinct 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzNzM3ODY3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzMyNDcyNA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Novelist Catherine Tramell is once again in trouble with the law, and Scotland Yard appoints psychiatrist Dr. Michael Glass to evaluate her. Though, like Detective Nick Curran before him, Glass is entranced by Tramell and lured into ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0430912/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ENRIQUE-3"},"dateCreated":"2006-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"It is now fashionable to trash "Basic Instinct 2" even before you see it.","reviewBody":"It seems that it is becoming fashionable to rip "Basic Instinct 2," to the point that a significant part of the audience (including critics) found it terrible even before it was released. It seems even more fashionable to trash Sharon Stone wholike all of usis now fourteen years older, andunlike most of usstill looks wonderful. First comments on this movie were so vicious that I had to see for myself. In my opinion, this sequel is not nearly as good as the original film, but is not as bad as most comments pretend. Michael Caton-Jones is not Paul Verhoeven, neither Henry Bean and Leora Barish are Joe Eszterhas. "Basic Instinct 2" is just an entertaining, average thriller, and besides the addition of Jerry Goldsmith original score, keeps little resemblance to its predecessor. Even Stone gives her character a different dimension, creating a lustful, devilish Catherine Trimell, who can perfectly well rank among other monsters like Hannibal Lecter. She is an intelligent actress who is not afraid of taking risks and can play with camp at her leisure. Unfortunately, she seems to be the main target for those who enjoy trashing this flick. She became too successful, too much of a main icon, and like all those actors who have reached that level, her time has arrived and she is now bound to be destroyed by Hollywood audiences.

The rest of the cast is outstanding, giving performances that are far better than the material deserves. David Morrissey is a much better actor and by far more interesting than Michael Douglas: his acting is flawless, giving a dense, complex dimension to an otherwise one dimensional character. Since he has more screen time and is the axis of the movie, he can keep your attention from beginning to end.

I am not recommending "Basic Instinct 2" as a great movie; I am just expressing my disagreement with most of the comments on this site and my conviction that agendas other than the movie itself are shaping the opinion of most spectators.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":38662,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2007-01-10","keywords":"narcissistic personality disorder,antisocial personality disorder,sex,consensual sex,female female kiss","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Basic Instinct 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi985202969","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTJmMTA5ZmUtOTRjMy00OGM2LTllNjEtNmI0YWJjMTE1YmQ0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTJmMTA5ZmUtOTRjMy00OGM2LTllNjEtNmI0YWJjMTE1YmQ0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000232/","name":"Sharon Stone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0607375/","name":"David Morrissey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000667/","name":"David Thewlis"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001994/","name":"Michael Caton-Jones"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066021/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010183/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000390/","name":"Joe Eszterhas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0054713/","name":"Leora Barish"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0063785/","name":"Henry Bean"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

It seems even more fashionable to trash Sharon Stone wholike all of usis now fourteen years older, andunlike most of usstill looks wonderful. First comments on this movie were so vicious that I had to see for myself. In my opinion, this sequel is not nearly as good as the original film, but is not as bad as most comments pretend. Michael Caton-Jones is not Paul Verhoeven, neither Henry Bean and Leora Barish are Joe Eszterhas. "Basic Instinct 2" is just an entertaining, average thriller, and besides the addition of Jerry Goldsmith original score, keeps little resemblance to its predecessor. Even Stone gives her character a different dimension, creating a lustful, devilish Catherine Trimell, who can perfectly well rank among other monsters like Hannibal Lecter. She is an intelligent actress who is not afraid of taking risks and can play with camp at her leisure. Unfortunately, she seems to be the main target for those who enjoy trashing this flick. She became too successful, too much of a main icon, and like all those actors who have reached that level, her time has arrived and she is now bound to be destroyed by Hollywood audiences.

The rest of the cast is outstanding, giving performances that are far better than the material deserves. David Morrissey is a much better actor and by far more interesting than Michael Douglas: his acting is flawless, giving a dense, complex dimension to an otherwise one dimensional character. Since he has more screen time and is the axis of the movie, he can keep your attention from beginning to end.

I am not recommending "Basic Instinct 2" as a great movie; I am just expressing my disagreement with most of the comments on this site and my conviction that agendas other than the movie itself are shaping the opinion of most spectators.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":38662,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.4,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2007-01-10","keywords":"narcissistic personality disorder,antisocial personality disorder,sex,consensual sex,female female kiss","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Basic Instinct 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi985202969","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTJmMTA5ZmUtOTRjMy00OGM2LTllNjEtNmI0YWJjMTE1YmQ0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTJmMTA5ZmUtOTRjMy00OGM2LTllNjEtNmI0YWJjMTE1YmQ0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000232/","name":"Sharon Stone","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0607375/","name":"David Morrissey","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000667/","name":"David Thewlis"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001994/","name":"Michael Caton-Jones"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066021/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010183/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000390/","name":"Joe Eszterhas","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0054713/","name":"Leora Barish","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0063785/","name":"Henry Bean"],"duration":"PT1H54M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Shield
programme.desc: Kapetan David Aceveda želi smanjiti stopu kriminala u svom okrugu Los Angeles. On se natječe s detektivom Vicom Mackeyjem i njegovim udarnim timom, specijalnom policijom koja se koristi nezakonitim... Kapetan David Aceveda želi smanjiti stopu kriminala u svom okrugu Los Angeles. On se natječe s detektivom Vicom Mackeyjem i njegovim udarnim timom, specijalnom policijom koja se koristi nezakonitim metodama u borbi protiv kriminala, ali vrlo učinkovitim.
